fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

With Atlassian Account enabled on the Cloud instances, users are automatically redirected to the login page of id.atlassian.com when they access the instance, ie. example.atlassian.net. This may cause confusion for the new users as they have no idea on why they are redirected to a different URL.

This has resulted in the loss of the ability of an admin to provide an unauthenticated landing-page experience which might provide a user with instructions on how to go about obtaining access, among other things. 
h3. Suggested resolution

Allow site-admin to choose an unauthenticated-user that would precede login, similar to JIRA/Confluence Home.
h3. Why this is important
 * Not all new users are familiar or know the steps of Atlassian Cloud Applications
 * With this feature, admins can brief the new users with the correct steps on either JIRA Dashboard or Confluence homepage.

h3. Workaround

*This workaround is only applied to instances with JIRA. This is because the link of _/wiki_ will always be redirected to id.atlassian.com*
 Provide a full link to the new users like example.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa
fields.summary: Allow site-admin to choose a landing page that precedes login

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Recently, Atlassian Account is introduced to Cloud applications (JIRA and Confluence). 
According to [How G Suite users log in|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/how-g-suite-users-log-in-744721643.html], users with G Suit enabled will still have to create a new Atlassian Account password in order to use some feature in JIRA.

h3. Suggested Solution
Integrate both, G Suite and Atlassian Account passwords so the users won't have to set up a new password for every new user created.
fields.summary: WIth G Suit enabled, it is still required to set up a new Atlassian Account password.

fields.description:
{panel:title=26 June update:}
We have started a progressive rollout. Customers can expect this data to be available within 24 hours. Historical data will be backfilled up to 6 months. 

The method for collecting this data has changed, allowing us to show product family level activity. Given this change, backfill data has been rebuilt. We chose to be conservative in our rebuild, meaning historical data may be under-reporting activity. We will be reflecting three bands of activity for the backfill data to reflect this. 

Exact date for activity within a month, active in the last 90 days, and active in the last 180 days. This banding will only apply for backfilled data.

We appreciate everyone's interest in this, it's a high priority feature for us and we are working to ship it as quickly as possible.
{panel}

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The os_authType=basic is not working in some Atlassian Cloud instances.

According to [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CLOUDKB/JIRA+and+Confluence+Cloud+os_username+and+os_password+embedded+in+URL+no+longer+available], os_authType=basic can be added to the URL, JIRA or Confluence will then request that a username and password is provided, however, it is not working for some instances.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Open an issue by adding the ?os_authType=basic at the end of the URL.
{code}https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/AD-145?os_authType=basic{code}
 
h3. Actual result
A blank page will open.

h3. Expected result
A prompt window will open requesting the username and password.
fields.summary: os_authType=basic is not working for some Atlassian Cloud instances.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are still able to login to Cloud instances using G Suite login even after G Suite is disconnected

h3. Environment

* CLOUD - JIRA v1000.789.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Connect Cloud instance to G Suite and Sync Users
# Disconnect G Suite

h3. Expected Results

* G Suite Login should be removed from Cloud login page
* Existing G Suite users should still be able to login via Cloud login instead

h3. Actual Results

* Log in Using Google option is still available on login page
* Users can still use the 'Log in Using Google' option to log in to Cloud instance
 
h3.Workaround

* None Currently
fields.summary: Users can still log in via G Suite/Google Apps Login after G Suite has been disconnected

fields.description:
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # login as the owner of the instance (username "Admin" by default).
 # Connect Google Apps.

h4. Expected results
 # Default username 'Admin' should be updated to reflect the username on the Google Apps (example.user@gmail.com -> username = example.user).


h4. Actual results
 # 'Admin' username not updated after GApps sync. 
 # User still able to login using "Admin" as username.

h4. Other info
 

h4. Workaround

To modify the username and reflect the change:
- Disconnect GApps Integration
- Edit User's Details in User Management with new Username
- Re-integrate with GApps

If you  do not what the GApps integration be disconnected:
- Create a new GApps account for the user with their New Name, Username, and Email Address
- User sign-ins with new GApps account and a new JIRA Account is created for them
- Disable access to the Old JIRA Account to free up licensing
- Optional: Re-assign issues that the user created with their Old GApps Account to the New
fields.summary: Username of the owner of the instance remains as "Admin" after Google Apps is connected

fields.description:
Users are missing avatars after the accounts being migrated to Atlassian Account.
Avatars can be added or changed from the user settings in id.atlassian.com

h3. How to replicate
# Enable Atlassian Account from User Management
# Ask users to go through the migration steps that will create and link an Atlassian Account
# Navigate through issues were that user has activity.

*Expected:*
Avatars still appear on the site for all users after the migration.

*Actual*
Avatars are not displayed for all users. Some of them show and some do not.
Missing avatars now show the default avatar.

h3. Notes
Avatars are not missing, they are simply not showing. They'll start showing again after some time.

h3. Workaround
Logout and login again to force a user sync sometimes fixes the problem for the user.

h3. Latest update
Developers have investigated the problem and detected the cause. A fix will be developed and released in upcoming releases.
fields.summary: Avatars missing/not showing after Atlassian Account migration

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When we have users that are synched to Google Apps, if the selected groups for synching in Google Apps are changed so that these users are no longer synched, these users are removed from Atlassian Cloud site.

This may be unexpected, if the administrator carrying out this operation simply wanted these users to not be synched from Google anymore, but keep local users and it's particularly unexpected if the users that are removed existed before the Google Apps connection started, as these users were not created from the synchronization.

Also, if these users are SD customers, if they are removed from this sync and recreated in another sync (trying to undo the previous delete),  they may be recreated with a wrong username, which causes them not be associated with previous content (issues they created, comments, etc.).

h3. Suggested Solution
Solutions could be:
# Not delete the users at all
# Give an option for the customer to select which users to delete (or no user at all) and only dissociate the others from Google Apps integration
# At least warn the customer this will cause user to be deleted.
fields.summary: Option to keep existing users when disconnected from Google Apps

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if we associate an Atlassian Cloud site with a Google Apps domain and include Service Desk customers with 'portal only' access, these users are given default access to the application and can no longer be changed into 'portal only' users.

This may cause important issues if this is done inadvertently by the user, such as:
# Giving these users access to content they should not have access to (so a security breach)
# Updating license, requiring customer to pay for a license.
# A lot of extra work to manually undo all the changes
# If the users are then removed from synchronization, by removing them from synched groups, this may remove all the users from their instance, causing further problems

h3. Suggested Solution
There are a number of possible solutions:
# Never sync SD users
# Sync them and keep them as portal only
# Give the administrator and option to either sync those users or not or an option to either raise their application access or not
# At least, show a warning that users will be given access to JIRA and which of them will
fields.summary: Don't give Service Desk customer JIRA access after Google Apps synchronization

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The [Google Apps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/managing-users-with-google-apps-868983099.html] documentation says:
{quote}
When you connect Google Apps, any users with an email matching one in Atlassian Cloud will be synced. Once synced, we use a Google ID to consolidate your user base. After initial sync it doesn't matter what email or username your users have, the Google ID is unique to every user.
{quote}

This is misleading, as it may suggest that the customer can edit username or email address in Atlassian once the the initial sync is done and have different values from Google. This is actually not possible from the Atlassian side, only changes in the Google Apps side can be done and are automatically synced to Atlassian Cloud site.

For example, this may suggest that a user can have a different email address in Atlassian, say, for notification, an a second one he uses to log in.

h3. Suggested Solution

Change documentation to make clear that the data can be changed from the Google Apps side and it's then synced.
fields.summary: Improve misleading Google Apps documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using the Atlassian ID instead of the username to call the  /rest/auth/1/session endpoint returns either error 401 or error 500


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Send a request to /rest/auth/1/session endpoint  having body \{"username":"USERNAME", "password":"********" }. See that this works correctly
# Send another request using the Atlassian ID instead of the username: \{"username":"EMAIL_ADDRESS", "password":"********" }

h3. Expected Results
You get the session id

h3. Actual Results
Error 401 or 500 is returned instead.

The below exception is thrown in the logs:
{noformat}
2017-02-10 13:36:50,136 http-nio-3000-exec-2 ERROR admin 816x1233x1  89.228.128.139 /rest/auth/1/session [c.a.j.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
      at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
      at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
      at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
      at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
      ...
...
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
      at com.atlassian.jira.rest.auth.LoginInfo.<init>(LoginInfo.java:27)
      at com.atlassian.jira.rest.auth.Login.login(Login.java:128)
      ... 290 more
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
Send the username in the request body instead of the email address.
fields.summary: Cannot call JIRA's session endpoint (/rest/auth/1/session) with email address (Atlassian ID) instead of username

fields.description:
h2. Problem

Google Apps GSync keeps spinning and not connecting
h2. Steps to reproduce
 # Connect to Google Apps GSync
 # The spinning wheels keeps spinning and the '_Start syncing users_' button is never clickable.
 # Check the Console Tools and you'll see Error 500

h2. Expected

Successfully connected to Google Apps
h2. Cause

The domain list is failing to load and JIRA has nothing to do with this. It is happened when JIRA has a valid token that Google allow us into but isn't allowed to read domains. Basically JIRA would ask Google for all the relevant permissions, including the permission to read the domain list but then this failure means Google said we can't. 

In another word it happens when JIRA and Google Apps is connected, JIRA would ask Google to make sure that the Google Apps admin performing the connection has permission to perform all the stuff, but when JIRA actually try to do that task on their behalf, it turns out that they're not allowed to.
h2. Workaround

Give some extra permissions to the Google Apps admin.
fields.summary: Infinite spinning wheels when connecting to Google Apps GSync

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Sometimes, when a customer tries to reset their Atlassian Account's password, the following error is thrown:
{code:java}OOPS, YOU'VE MADE A MALFORMED REQUEST. If you came here from a link we sent you, please contact support.{code}

h3. Suggested Solution

Although potentially there's a variety of reasons why we see this error, one of the reason is broken link from mail client which handles HTML as plain-text.
Therefore, it should be nice to provide a way to copy-and-paste the link like the image below.

!ID-6249.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Most of the times this issue is resolved by:
# Clearing browser's cache.
# Disabling browser extensions or trying in private browsing mode.
# Turning on and off referrer protection.
# In case you use Capture for Jira, disable it
# Open the email in HTML (not in plain text)

It'd be interesting if the message would provide more relevant information so that the customers could be pointed towards a resolution for themselves.
fields.summary: Update the "Oops, you've made a malformed request" error message to a more adequate one and provide a URL in plain text

h3. Problem Definition

When a user resets their password, they are asked to enter the new password once:   !Screen Shot 2016-11-25 at 15.19.20.png|thumbnail!
 Sometimes, they may make a typo in their new password (give a different password than intended) and use the wrong password to log in afterwards.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a second field in that form above, {{Confirm password}}, where the user has to enter their password for a second time.
h3. Why this is important

This will make it less likely that the user enters a password other than intended.
fields.summary: Add a 'Confirm password' field in the reset password page

fields.description:
h3. Description

Have a text field displaying some conditions for password on Atlassian ID, especially after a password reset is done.

h3. Example 

In a situation where the customer has to reset his password, he should be warned to choose a unique password.Otherwise, he will be prompt to reset his password again and again.

h3. Suggestion

Create a condition that he/she is not able to input the same password as before, if it's the first time, warn then that in the next change he should choose a different password.
fields.summary: Warn customers that after a password reset, a unique password should be chosen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When integrating an instance with Google Apps, the synchronization fails if the email address contains capital letters
h3. Environment

JIRA/Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to User management
 # Select Google Apps in the sidebar
 # Select Connect Google Apps
 # Select which groups you want to sync from Google Apps

h3. Expected Results

Synchronization happens
h3. Actual Results

Error 'Your user base might be out of date. We're still syncing your user base, but X of your users can't be synced. Download the report to check which users couldn't be synced and why'

When downloading the report it shows error: 'The email address could not be updated, as a user with the new email address already exists.'
h3. Workaround

As a site admin and google admin, disconnect the Google integration, set the affected user email address in lower case, resync. If you encounter further issues please open a ticket for support referencing this bug.
fields.summary: New integration with Google fails if user email contains capital letters

fields.description:
Atlassian is aware of an issue with our Atlassian Cloud service that is causing the login page to fail to load.

We are investigating this issue as a high priority and will provide updates on this ticket.
fields.summary: Atlassian Cloud Login Page not loading

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When logged in as Aa in a Cloud instance, if the we close the browser, most of the time the session is lost and we need to log in again to the Cloud instance. Sometimes, it won't log you out the first time the browser is closed, but a second attempt will.

The Aa session remains valid, that is, if we open other Atlassian pages that use Atlassian Account as authentication, we won't need to log in again, but the Cloud instance will require:
!login.png|thumbnail!


h3. Environment
Test in browser: Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to a Cloud instance using Aa
# Close the browser completely
# Reopen it
# If necessary, to it a second time

h3. Expected Results
The user will remain logged, as other sites using Aa remain logged.

h3. Actual Results
The user is logged out and needs to log in again.
 
h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: AA is causing browser session to be lost

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
After the Atlassian Account migration, admins are not able to set/change the password manually anymore.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Restore the ability for admins to set the password manually during user creation and change the password manually.
fields.summary: Ability to Change Password

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

When making changes to the _"Sign up options"_ and saving the changes, the changes do not get applied. 

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Go to {{https://<instance url>/admin/signup}}
# Tick or untick the *Turn on self sign up*
# Click *Save*. You will see a "Successfully saved sign up settings" message on the top right.
# Log out, and select *Return to log in page*.

h3. Actual Result 

- If step 2 above is ticked, *Create an account* link is missing.
- If step 2 above is unticked, *Create an account* link still appears. 

h3. Expected Result

- If step 2 above is ticked, *Create an account* link is shown.
- If step 2 above is unticked, *Create an account* link should not be shown. 

h3. Notes 

It seems that the instance keeps the default settings and any changes made are not applied.
fields.summary: Sign up options does not apply changes made

fields.description:

When an instance has Atlassian Account SSO enabled, JIRA REST API - Basic authentication is not working
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud Version 1000.482.3
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable SSO to an instance
 # Add a new user that already has Atlassian Account ID
 # Use your Atlassian Account id to run JIRA REST API - Basic authentication

h3. Expected Results
 * It should REST clients to authenticate using the Atlassian Account ID and password

h3. Actual Results
 * Getting {{401 Unauthorized}} error

h3. Note

* It's only not working for new users that was not able to set a password in the instance before.

fields.description:
Summary
User management filter for 'System Users' show all users including system users instead of just System Users.

Environment
Cloud

Steps to Reproduce
Go to User Management
Make sure that 'Active Users' and 'Inactive Users' are unchecked
Select 'System Users' 

 !system_users_siteadmin.png|thumbnail! 

Expected Results
The list of users should show only System Users (as Active and Inactive users are unchecked)


Notes
no errors in hlog

The result when selecting system users only are redundant as you can achieve the same result if the user select Active Users + System Users

Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When we have few times of failed login, id.atlassian.com will prompt Google Recaptcha upon login. This is not convenience for China users as Google is blocked in China.
h3. Suggestion
 # Use In-House Recaptcha method
 # Allow admin to clear the failed login count or disable Recaptcha if the domain is verified in the instance.

h3. Workaround
 # Apply VPN to turn around the China restriction.
 # Use "having trouble logging in" link to reset a new password:
 ## Click on the '"having trouble logging in" link at the main login page
 ## Enter the affected email address, click "I'm not a robot" and do the Google captcha dance.
 ## Send.
## You will then receive a password reset email so you can set up a new password, by passing the Google captcha.
fields.summary: China Users Face "Google Recaptcha Failed to Load" When Logging In

fields.description:
*Summary*

# When a new user is created in JIRA cloud instance. An invitation email is sent to the user to join Confluence. Please refer the below screenshot of the email.
!invite.png!

*Suggestion*
Provide an option to disable the additional emails Confluence sent to users.

fields.description:
h3. {color:#ff0000}*Update*{color}

{color:#333333}*This issue has been recognised by Google Engineers as an issue with Google Authentication and Google are actively investigating the issue.*{color}

{color:#333333}*The workaround being suggested by Google is still the same: "Re-authenticate the application", which means disconnect from Google Apps integration and re-connect.*{color}

{color:#333333}*http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40488769/google-oauth2-tokens-invalidated-more-and-more/40521704#40521704*{color}
----
h3. Summary

When having Google Apps integration enabled in your Cloud instance some users cannot log in and they get error: 'Unexpected error in the authentication system'
h3. Environment

Atlassian Cloud with Google Apps enabled
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your cloud instance
 # Try to log in using your google account

h3. Expected Results

Log in successful
h3. Actual Results

Error 'Unexpected error in the authentication system' is thrown. No access is possible. This only affects a limited number of customers.

!Screen_Shot_2016-10-26_at_09_45_11.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Ask one of your site-admins in the Cloud instance and admin in the Google domain to disable/enable the Google Apps integration in the user management. Further details on the how to do this can be found here: [Integrate with Google Apps|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Integrate+with+Google+Apps]

To login to your Cloud instance when Google Apps isn't working you can use the standard login using your email address and password prior to Google Apps being synched. If you're unsure of your login credentials use https://<instance>.atlassian.net/login/forgot to recover them.
fields.summary: Users with Google Apps integration cannot log in to their instance

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement

When site-admin creates a new user account, an invitation email is sent to the email address stated. However, the site-admin is not able to check whether the invitation is delivered successfully. If users report that they does not receive the invitation email, site admin would need to create a support ticket to check for the delivery status and error message.

Besides, even if the invitation is resent, it will not be delivered as the email address has been added to a suppression list. Site-admin would need to contact support to remove the email address from the suppression list in order to resend the invitation.
h3. Suggestion

It would be nice if site-admins able to get the delivery status of the invitation email. For example, adding a status field to track the delivery status and provide the error message if invitation email is failed to deliver.

Automatically remove the email address after a period of time so admin can resend the invitation to the users after they have fixed the error.
fields.summary: Improvement for Undelivered Invitation Email

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Recently, Atlassian Account is introduced to Cloud applications (JIRA and Confluence). Sometimes, Google ReCAPTCHA is required for few failed login attempts. This is not convenience for users from China as they need VPN connection to access google.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add disabled Google ReCAPTCHA on Password Policy setting
* When the domain is verified, admins can configure the Password Policy. It would be nice if Google ReCAPTCHA option is configurable as part of the Password Policy.
fields.summary: Ability For Admin to Disable Google Captcha for Atlassian Account

After enabling the Single Sign-on option with Atlassian Account, changing the Profile information in Atlassian account won't update the current Profile information in Cloud instance.

JIRA Cloud v1000.383.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to User Profile in JIRA: Profile Icon > Profile > *Update these details through your Atlassian account.*

The Full Name in Cloud instance will be updated with the new value

fields.description:
h2.Summary

User receive email about verifying their domain as they are using custom Atlassian password policy. They are not able to verify Cloud or non-HTTPS support domains

h2.Workaround

Domain verification is not for Cloud domains (acme.atlassian.net) but for personal email domains (acme.com). Non-HTTPS supported domains are also not supported. Please refer to our public facing KB below for more indepth details on the domain verification feature.

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Purchasing/Managed+accounts+and+domain+claim+verification

Administrators that does not have permission or unable to claim domain are unable to managed their users under SSO with Atlassian Account, thus they could not apply authentication policies across their organization and manage their users.

Allow "offline"  options for no claimed domain to allow administration of users for SSO

fields.description:

After enabling the Single Sign-on option with Atlassian Account, Confluence users are unable to set their Profile Information (Phone, IM, Website, About Me, Position, Department, Location)

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to User Profile in Confluence: Profile Icon > Profile > Edit Profile
# Populate the Fields under Personal and Company

Changes are saved

Page refreshes and changes are reverted.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 30 March 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3c78b5|titleBGColor=#3c78b5|bgColor=#e7f4fa}
Hello Everyone,

We have introduced DNS TXT method as an additional method to claim your domain. This option is available under "Domains" in Site administration. For more info, check out our documentation on [Managed accounts and domain claim verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/purchasing/managed-accounts-and-domain-claim-verification-846071711.html].
h3. *A bit about our vision*

At Atlassian we believe that everyone should be able to collaborate together in teams to create amazing things, and do so with the confidence their data is safe. [Find out more about our vision|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-cloud-collaboration-basics-873871187.html].

We've designed Atlassian account as your single passport into any team you collaborate with on Atlassian cloud products. By authenticating with Atlassian account you gain the ability to navigate between all the teams you are a member of, without the need to revalidate who you are. With an Atlassian account, it's easy to join and be invited to collaborate.

When teams form, they often work on sensitive information. We understand that protecting this information is paramount for many teams and organisations. We aim to provide the administrators of teams as well as the members within those teams with tools to protect themselves and their data.

 
*So what's next?*
*We are progressively upgrading all our cloud customers to Atlassian account and expected to complete this roll out by early May 2017.* 

We recommend [verifying your user's email domain(s) |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Domain+verification]before upgrading to [Atlassian account|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/atlassian-account-for-users-873871199.html] to maintain continuity of your password policy. Once we switch you to Atlassian account, your password policy will apply to all users on verified domain(s) when Atlassian account is enabled. Users will not be logged out during this transition and they will continue to have access to the site, without the need to change their password.

 
*Stay in contact with us*
We'd like to continue to work with you to understand your specific use case and how any of these changes affect you. Please continue to post your comments and feedback.

 

Cheers,
Adarsh
Atlassian Product Management

 

We receive a lot of requests for new features and improvements, so if you'd like to better understand how we make roadmap decisions, please read: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DEV/Implementation+of+New+Features+Policy]
{panel}
 
h3. HTTPS verification

The HTTPS domain verification as documented on [Managed accounts and domain claim verification|https://confluence.atlassian.com/purchasing/managed-accounts-and-domain-claim-verification-846071711.html] will work for a large number of our customers.
 * Supports [https://example.com|https://example.com/] and [https://www.example.com|https://www.example.com/]
 * [Lets Encrypt|http://letsencrypt.org/] can be used to obtain a free certificate
 * The token can appear anywhere on the page. For example this allows it to be embedded within CMS page

DNS verification

 DNS TXT—Copy a TXT record to your domain name system (DNS). It may take up to 72 hours for the TXT record changes take effect, but it will most likely happen sooner.
fields.summary: Allow additional methods of verifying a domain for administrators

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for groups or users, the User Management takes long to load and sometimes becomes unresponsive.
 A 500 error is shown for some requests
h3. Environment
 * User Management in Atlassian Cloud with more than 1500 users

h3. Cause
The application "horde" that manages users, runs out of memory and restarts itself every now and then when performing searches. It normally takes 30 seconds to restart and searches work after that for a while. It automatically adds more memory up to 256mb but the problem persists.
The cause is the amount of users and attributes being requested generates too much information that use all the memory.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a user details
 # Click on "Add group"
 # start typing to search for groups

h3. Expected Results
Groups are displayed in drop down

h3. Actual Results
Spinning wheel keeps spinning. Request times out.

Horde logs:

      at com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.rest.util.EntityTranslator.toUserEntity(EntityTranslator.java:99)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.rest.util.EntityTranslator.toUserEntities(EntityTranslator.java:137)
      at com.atlassian.crowd.plugin.rest.service.controller.SearchController.searchUsers(SearchController.java:180)

      at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
      at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
      at com.atlassian.plugins.rest.common.interceptor.impl.DispatchProviderHelper$ResponseOutInvoker$1.invoke(DispatchProviderHelper.java:192)

Users must be manually edit or deleted, one at a time.

Provide users in Cloud with a way to bulk delete and edit users

fields.description:
Some email servers or clients wrap links in a proxy. Due to the length and complexity of the links that are sometimes produced in our email verification flows, some of the services behind these proxies don't handle our links very well. You might get a generic looking 404 or a 500 page.
h5. Workaround

Open [https://id.atlassian.com/login/resetpassword] and enter your email address (make sure you use the same address that is used in the email that you received with the verification link). You will receive an email with a new, shorter, link that will allow you to verify your email address.

Once you have followed the new link successfully you will be able to access your Cloud site without having to log in again.
fields.summary: Verify email link does not work

fields.description:
Current behavior of GApps user synchronization for newly provisioned instances:

# User signs up for OnDemand, and an admin user account is created.
# User would integrate their GApps domain with OnDemand.
# If their username is different than their GApps username, a new user will be created.
# The user would then login using their new GApps user expecting it to have admin powers. But it doesn't
# User will need to logout, login with the original admin account, and assign the new GApps user to admin group.



There should be some kind of warning or an information provided to the user when integrating to Google Apps to inform about the steps needed to be taken. Also, there should be another warning that the GApps login will not work with mobile phones or JIRA Mobile Connect, as currently those 3rd party Apps doesn't support this functionality and users need to set a JIRA password from their profile.
fields.summary: Inform administrators about caveats prior to enabling GApps integration

fields.description:
When a user try to access an OnDemand instance without a valid username, the instance will only throw an error message saying: *Your account is not yet available in this OnDemand instance*. 

Customers would appreciate if this error message could be descriptive on the root cause and how to move forward.
fields.summary: Better guidance for users who are yet to have their accounts in an OnDemand instance

fields.description:
At the moment, users receive notifications for the support tickets they open in their Atlassian account email.

Some users would like to be able to associate multiple emails to their Atlassian account, and receive notifications to all emails as well.
fields.summary: Allow users to add multiple e-mails in an Atlassian account, and receive notifications in all of them

fields.description:
{panel:title=RESOLVED|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We've recently released a new version of the G Suite integration which supports these features:
 * As an admin, you can eagerly provision and sync your entire G Suite user base, or specific G Suite groups, to your Atlassian site. 
 * Your synced users will have their details updated from G Suite every 4 hours. 
 * Every time you add a new G Suite user to a synced group, they will be provisioned to your Atlassian site the next time a sync runs.
 * When you remove a user from a synced group (or deactivate/delete their G Suite account), they will be removed from your Atlassian Cloud site the next time a sync runs. 
 * If you have an enabled Atlassian account for your instance, your users will be required to use their Google credentials to authenticate. 

 

To enable Atlassian account for your instance, go to the *Atlassian account* page inside *User Management*. Enabling Atlassian account for your site will allow you to enforce your users to log in using their Google credentials. Learn more about Atlassian account [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/joMCL].

 

To enable the new G Suite integration for your site, go to the *G Suite* page inside *User Management.* Make sure that you have G Suite groups that are representative of your Atlassian Cloud userbase. 
 * If you have not yet integrated with G Suite, you will automatically have the new version of the integration. See [enable G Suite integration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/LvAWN] for instructions on how to integrate your site.
 * If your site is currently integrated with G Suite, see [is my site using group-based syncing?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/G+Suite+FAQs#GSuiteFAQs-Ismysiteusinggroup-basedsyncing?] 
 ** If your site is using group-based syncing, then you have the new version of the integration.
 ** If your site is not using group-based syncing, then you will need to disconnect from your current integration by clicking *Disconnect G Suite* and then *Connect G Suite* to re-integrate your G Suite data. Make sure that you have administrator access on your G Suite domain to set up the integration. You can find the required admin privileges [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/G+Suite+FAQs#GSuiteFAQs-AfterIgrantthepermissionsrequired,Icannotsyncmyusers.What%27swrong?].{panel}


h3. Problem Definition

Customers would like to fully manage users via Google and not via Cloud User Management. For example, when a user leaves a company, they can revoke the Google access, and not have to manage anything within Cloud.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide an option for Cloud Site Admins to prohibit Cloud login and require Google authentication.
h3. Notes

Original Request:
{quote}Our organization uses many cloud based applications that are able to utilize Google Apps SSO. This is convenient for our users who are able to take advantage of this SSO to login and uses different services with the same credentials. However, as users leave the company access to these resources needs to be revoked. If users are only able to login with Google Apps SSO then it gives us the convenience of simply disabling their Google account and removing access to this application versus having to manage the users within Jira's User Management interface.
{quote}
fields.summary: Option to disable Atlassian OnDemand Login so users can only log in with Google Apps SSO

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create a user via the UI it's not possible to create a user with the same email address as an existing user. If you create a user via the REST API (for example by using the csv importer) then you can easily create a user with the same email address as an existing user.

h3. Suggested Solution

Validate the API call to ensure that no users already exist with that email address. If they do then reject the user creation.
 
h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Identity API does not prevent creating users with duplicate email addresses

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

h4. Mobile App

* Log into JIRA Mobile app
* Do a Basic Auth request from your desktop
* Go back to JIRA Mobile app

Expected: You are still logged in to JIRA Mobile app
Actual: You are logged out (the SSO token is invalid)

Note that the mobile app only stores the {{studio.crowd.tokenkey}} SSO token.

h4. Web App

* Log into JIRA Web app
* Do a Basic Auth request 
* Go back to JIRA Web app 10 mins later

Expected: You are still logged in to JIRA Web app
Actual: You are logged out (the SSO token is invalid)

Note that the JIRA Web app also uses a JIRA-specific JSESSIONID token and IIUC does some caching of the validity of the SSO token.
fields.summary: Cloud User is logged out of unrelated session after doing a Basic Auth call

fields.description:
There should be a small section in the the GAPPS documentation on how to disconnect GAPPS from JIRA Cloud. 

* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Integrate+with+Google+Apps

My customer was concerned whether there are side effects from disconnecting GAPPS. So a small section on that will be nice.
fields.summary: Add a small section on the documentation on how to disconnect Google Apps from JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a New User self-signs up for an account in a Cloud Instance, the Admin receives an email message showing an incorrect number of seats available in the instance.  It shows more users available than currently registered for.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 1000.25.1 (Cloud) 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Enable [User Self-Signup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Enable+self+sign+up] within User Management
# Enable the option to "Notify administrators by email when an account is created by create or sign up"
# In another Browser or 'Incognito Mode,' Access instance and Click 'Create an Account' to create a new account
#- Verify account and Admin should receive the "New User Notification" 

h3. Expected Results
When the new user creates an account, the notification the Admin receives should show an accurate number of seats left in their license. 

h3. Actual Results
Notification email seems to indicate a total of 2000 User Licenses in an instance.
Created an Evaluation Instance with 10 users; 2 Users total in Instance:
!NewUserNotification.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
License usage can be verified by going to !https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/444107050/cog.png! > User Management > Application Access
fields.summary: New User Notification to Admins Show an Incorrect Number of Seats Available

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence does not have the ability to manually configure which groups should be the 'Default' ones for new created users. When the confluence-users group does not have access to Confluence the assignment of the 'Default' group is given to all the non-admin existing groups. See example below

!image-2016-06-02-17-52-05-264.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution

Have the ability to choose which of the groups should be assigned as default regardless of them being admin or not.
fields.summary: Ability to choose default groups in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Presently, site-admins have no way to restrict REST API access or view usage. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a REST API sub-tab in the *Application Access* screen
https://example.atlassian.net/admin/apps

And display/group the users that have explicit *API access* 
https://example.atlassian.net/admin/accessconfig

I think if a user is added to the developers group, API access would automatically be granted. Otherwise, there is no reason to provide all users with API access unless its required and sanctioned by a site-admin.
fields.summary: As a site-admin, I want to control REST API usage with Application Access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers utilizing non-English language Settings within JIRA do not receive a Translated Password Reset Email like they do for standard JIRA Notifications

h5. Steps to Reproduce
Change Language Settings in User Profile to something other than English; for testing used French
# Click Profile Icon > Profile
# Edit Preferences, Choose French, and Update
# Logout and Attempt a Password Reset by using the "Unable to Access Your Account" link

h5. Expected Results
Password Reset email is in the user's selected Language

h5. Actual Results
Password Reset Email is sent in English
!1.UserPreferences.png|thumbnail!
!2.PasswordResetEmail.png|thumbnail!
!3.NotificationEmail.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Incorporate an option where the User's Language Setting or the System Default Language setting is used with the Password Reset Email

h3.Workaround
none
fields.summary: Password Reset Email Does Not Use User's JIRA Language Setting

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When importing a backup containing deactivated users into Cloud, the deactivated users are made active.
This causes customers to exceed their tier in Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a JIRA backup or Confluence backup from an instance containing deactivated users (either Server or Cloud)
# import the backup into Cloud

h3. Expected Results
the imported deactivated users are still deactivated on the Cloud instance

h3. Actual Results
imported deactivated users are active on the Cloud instance

h3.Workaround
Manually deactivate the wrongly imported user.
fields.summary: Deactivated users imported to Cloud from a backup are reactivated.

fields.description:
See attached screenshot.

# Accept an invite from HipChat using an address domain (e.g., atlassian.com) that is blacklisted via Atlassian Identity but not blacklisted in HipChat.
# Observe error tells you you use a different email
# Observe UI does not provide a means for changing your email

Expected: Invite UI allows you to change your email
fields.summary: Frustrating error message - can't change email address on an invite

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Administrators can no longer edit usernames of Google Apps users in the User Management section of Atlassian Cloud, even when Google Apps has been disconnected. This is an important functionality as editing usernames in Atlassian Cloud is an essential step of a workaround to sync name changes from GApps to Atlassian Cloud: [ID-257|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ID-257]. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Cloud instance
# Connect instance to your Google Apps domain
# Create a user with Google Apps access
# Disconnect Google Apps
# Try to edit the Username of the Google Apps user in User Management  

h3. Expected Results
You are able to successfully change the Username of this user. 
h3. Actual Results
You receive the message: {{USER is a Google Apps user and cannot be renamed.}} as shown in the screenshot below:
!gapps_user.png|thumbnail!
There are no errors in the logs, however if you check the database, you can see that even though Google Apps is deactivated, the GApps attribute is still being assigned to users in the database. 
 
h3.Workaround
If you encounter this issue, please file a ticket at support.atlassian.com. Our support team can make a database change that will allow you to update usernames.
fields.summary: Administrators can no longer edit usernames in User Management even when Google Apps has been disconnected

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If you somehow have 2 users on Atlassian Cloud that share the same email address (inactive or active) then you won't be able to login with that email address. You get an error that says:

{quote}It looks like you are trying to use your email address to log in. Please use your Atlassian Cloud username instead.{quote}

This error is misleading and leads users to believe that they are not able to login with their email address.

h3. Suggested Solution
Change the error to explain that since they are trying to login with an email address that is shared with multiple users, they'll need to login with the username instead.

h3. Notes
I am aware that it's no longer possible to create users with the same email, but it could still be from before or if it was a CSV user import.
 
h3. Workaround 
Change the email address on one of the email accounts and you'll be able to login with your username and email.
fields.summary: When logging in with shared email address, error is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The 'administrator' group is used for mapping user permissions to log into WebDAV. If a user removes this group, they will no longer be able to log into WebDAV.

h3. Environment

Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add users to the 'administrators' group
# Remove the 'administrators' group from User Management
# Attempt to log into WebDAV

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to log into WebDAV

h3. Actual Results

User cannot log into WebDAV/
 
h3. Notes

Removing the 'administrators' group from User Management causes a break in the 'cwd_app_dir_group_mapping' table within the Crowd database.

{noformat}
crowd=> select * from cwd_app_dir_group_mapping;
   id   | app_dir_mapping_id | application_id | directory_id |        group_name
--------+--------------------+----------------+--------------+---------------------------
 229377 |             196609 |              2 |        32769 | system-administrators
 229389 |             196615 |              8 |        32769 | system-administrators
 229391 |             196620 |             11 |        32769 | system-administrators
 229392 |             196609 |              2 |        32769 | site-admins
 229393 |             196609 |              2 |        32769 | confluence-administrators
 229394 |             196609 |              2 |        32769 | atlassian-addons
 229390 |             196615 |              8 |        32769 | administrators
(7 rows)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround

Support is able to remap the 'administrators' group so WebDAV access is restored

{noformat}
insert into cwd_app_dir_group_mapping values (229390, 196615, 8, 32769, 'administrators');
{noformat}
fields.summary: 'administrators' group should not be removable in User Management

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When creating groups within User Management, users can create groups with different letter case. When remapping the 'cwd_app_dir_group_mapping' in the Crowd database, WebDAV access for example will not work if this is mapped to administrators but the group is spelled Administrators in User Management.

e.g., Administrators is treated as a different name than administrators

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure the administrators group does not exist first
# Create a group named Administrators starting with an upper case A 
# Add a user to this group
# Attempt to log into WebDAV

h3. Expected Results

User should be able to log into WebDAV

h3. Actual Results

User receives an error that their log in is invalid
 
h3. Notes

This is important to know when users delete the administrators group in User Management and can no longer log into WebDAV. The group must be recreated however it appears in the Crowd database.

h3.Workaround

User must remove the Administrators group and create a new group called administrators using a lowercase A
fields.summary: WebDAV Crowd mapping does not check for group with different beginning case

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to customize Cloud login page.
h3. Suggested Solution

Provide ability to customize Cloud login page.
fields.summary: Ability to customize Cloud login page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As an Admin, you can choose to view a list of active users with Application Access, or inactive users, but not active users with NO application access (including without customer portal access)

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a *no access* option that shows any active users that were not yet given application access of any kind.
 
h3. Workaround 
Please request the Cloud engineer run a database query to obtain the list of users.
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to view active users with no application access

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Users who have signed up for an Atlassian account currently has no option to delete their Atlassian ID/account should they decide to opt out of using Atlassian-related items.

h3. Suggested Solution

Provide the option for users to delete their Atlassian account via my.atlassian.com (with sufficient warning of the effects, of course)
fields.summary: Allow user to delete their Atlassian ID account

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a user has an invalid email address, is not possible edit it's information nor change the invalid email address for the correct one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Cog icon > User management*
# Select the user with the incorrect email address and click *Edit*
# Modify the email address and click *Save*. Nothing happens.

h3. Expected Results
The email address would be changed accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
The email doesn't get updated. The developers tool displays: 
{noformat}
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 404 (Not Found)
Failed to load resource: the server responded with a status of 400 (Bad Request)
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
The email address can be updated directly in the database. Please [raise a support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com] so we can perform the changes for you.
fields.summary: Having an invalid email address prevents the right email address of being saved

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, an audit request is required in the database by support to see a list of users who have not logged in for a period of time. These users can be taking up licenses in the system unnecessarily.

h3. Suggested Solution
Introducing the ability to specify a length of time where if a user has not logged in past that time, they are temporarily deactivated, freeing up the license.
fields.summary: As an admin, ability to automatically deactivate inactive users

fields.description: It would be nice if we have an option to disable the button "password reset" for some groups in Confluence.
fields.summary: Disable "password reset" for groups in Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

# If a user already exists and you try to create another user with the same email address it fails without showing an error.
# If a user already exists and you try to create another user with the same email address though bulk create, it shows *maxResults must be positive* error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a user on an instance with < 3 users
# Try to create another user with the same email address

h3. Expected Results

An error is thrown saying that email address is already taken.

h3. Actual Results

No error is thrown at all.
If the user is added through bulk create, error *maxResults must be positive* is shown.
 
h3. Notes

This is exacerbated by an 'inactive' user that doesn't appear on the list by default.
Suggest the error message to be meaningful, eg : *The user already exists*

h3.Workaround

Create a user with a different email address or remove the original user.
fields.summary: Creating a user that already exists via quick add does not throw error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In Microsoft Exchange/Outlook, users have a feature to have an avatar and profile information such as job title.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for Confluence to import this automatically from those applications.

h3. Workaround 
At this point, the only way to do this in Confluence is by updating user picture and profile information manually.
fields.summary: Support for Exchange/Outlook avatar and account information integration with Confluence users

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Password policy, if set, applies to all users. Such as, a 90-day password expiration policy.
Sometimes users will only want certain logins to have the policy applied to them, but not to others.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow a flag to be set to avoid having the password policy apply to the user
fields.summary: As an admin, select users to have password policy overidden

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Since the type of cwd_proerty.property_value is varchar(4000), error occurs internally if you grant Application Access to too many groups (more than 200 groups, for example). The error will prevent you from changing license type (from JIRA Core to JIRA Software, for example).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Grant Application Access to more than 200 groups via "Application access configuration" page (https://<ATLASSIAN_CLOUD_URL>/admin/accessconfig)
# Ask Atlassian to change the license type (from JIRA Core to JIRA Software for example)

h3. Expected Results
License type changes properly

h3. Actual Results
License type does not change.

h3.Workaround
Ask [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23] to resolve the problem temporarily
fields.summary: Cannot change license type if you grant Application Access to many groups in Cloud environment

fields.description:
I am administering a site for a non-profit organisation. Users do not have neatly structured email addresses as might be found in a corporate environment.

The heuristic used to create user names is totally inappropriate in this environment.

Workaround:
* Add user with email of <name.i.want.@example.com>
* Edit user to put in correct email address
* Resend welcome email, as the first went to example.com (Of course the welcome email is also totally inappropriate ID-93)
fields.summary: User name created when adding users is not appropriate

fields.description:
I tried to update a users password the strength meter in the UI showed the password as strong, but then I got an error saying it was weak. WTF

The site required a "Fair" strength password.
fields.summary: Password Strength calculations out of sync between front and back ends

h3. Notes

Tested on 3 different Cloud instances. All instance produce the same error consistently. 

h3.Workaround

None found. Using the short keyboard dialog and navigating to User Management will cause the "Back to JIRA" button to not function correctly.
To avoid this bug you can:
# To use the "Cog Wheel" > Select "User Management" > Back to JIRA button will still work
# Use the back arrow on your browser after using the shortcut dialog box.
fields.summary: Using "Back to JIRA" button in User Management screen causes errors to display on page

fields.description: Confluence is implementing audit logging. As part of this there is a REST API which allows 3rd parties to put entries into the audit log. It would be good to include records of admins that 'Login as another user' in Confluence.
fields.summary: Audit log of 'Login as another user' in Confluence
